SEARCH
Package com.example.UseCaseDiagram

Class UseCaseController.UseCaseSubject

java.lang.Object
com.example.UseCaseDiagram.UseCaseController.UseCaseSubject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Enclosing class:
UseCaseController
public static class UseCaseController.UseCaseSubject extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a subject in a UML use-case diagram that contains multiple use cases. Defines boundaries, position, and functionality to manage contained use cases.
See Also:

    • width

      public double width
      Width of the subject. Default is 200.

    • height

      public double height
      Height of the subject. Default is 150.

    • count

      public static int count
      Counter for generating unique subject names.

      Name of the subject, generated uniquely by default.

    • UseCaseSubject

      public UseCaseSubject(double x, double y)
      Constructs a UseCaseSubject at a specified position with default size.
      Parameters:
      x - the X-coordinate of the top-left corner of the subject
      y - the Y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the subject

  • Method Details

    • isMouseOver

      public boolean isMouseOver(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Checks if the mouse is over the subject's area.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - the X-coordinate of the mouse
      mouseY - the Y-coordinate of the mouse
      Returns:
      true if the mouse is over the subject's area, false otherwise

    • isMouseOverBorder

      public boolean isMouseOverBorder(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Checks if the mouse is over the border of the subject for resizing purposes.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - the X-coordinate of the mouse
      mouseY - the Y-coordinate of the mouse
      Returns:
      true if the mouse is over the border, false otherwise

    • addUseCase

      public void addUseCase(UseCaseController.UseCase useCase)
      Adds a use case to the subject's list of contained use cases.
      Parameters:
      useCase - the UseCase to be added

      Checks if a point is within the subject's boundaries.
